Description: Rim and body sherd of North Ionian pottery bird bowl; interior glazed (fired reddish brown in places) with band in added white near bottom; exterior: glazed area at left; to right, metope decoration consisting of outlined cross-hatched lozenge framed by wide and bands.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For parallels, see British Museum 1924,1201.878 and Bristol H4620. See also Cook, East Greek Painted Pottery, 1960, pl. 29d.
Bibliographic references: Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 79, Nau 13, pl. 3e-f)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.076)
